Article.ArticleTitle: Lifetimes and decay mechanisms of isotopically substituted ozone above the dissociation threshold: matching quantum and classical dynamics.

AbstractText: Energies and lifetimes of vibrational resonances were computed for <sup>18</sup>O-enriched isotopologue <sup>50</sup>O<sub>3</sub> = {<sup>16</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O<sup>18</sup>O and <sup>16</sup>O<sup>18</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O} of the ozone molecule using hyperspherical coordinates and the method of complex absorbing potential. Various types of scattering resonances were identified, including roaming OO-O rotational states, the series corresponding to continuation of bound vibrational resonances of highly excited bending or symmetric stretching vibrational modes. Such a series become metastable above the dissociation limit. The coupling between the vibrationally excited O<sub>2</sub> fragment and rotational roaming gives rise to Feshbach type resonances in ozone. Different paths for the formation and decay of symmetric <sup>16</sup>O<sup>18</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O and asymmetric species <sup>16</sup>O<sup>16</sup>O<sup>18</sup>O were also identified. The symmetry properties of the total rovibronic wave functions of the <sup>18</sup>O-enriched isotopologues are discussed in the context of allowed dissociation channels.
